bibl.title: Samuel Gowan and Donald Webster v. JH McGraw. Final Decisions.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington Third Judicial District| ss.
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle, King County
In the Matter of the Application of Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster for a Writ of Habeas Corpus| Demeaner to Sheriff's Return
div1.p: The said Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster and each of them demmer to the return of the Sheriff to the writ in the above matter and expect to the sufficiency hereof for the following reasons to wit:

That the containment set up in said relian as authority for the detention of said applicants is not sufficent to hold them upon, for the reason that it does not show or allege any offense over which one Justice issuing, such commitment did not have full authority to hear determine and punish.

That these said applicants were
not found by said Justice to be guilty of any offence, nor does said commitment state or show in any way that the offence therein charged would not have been sufficently punished by a fine, not exceeding $100.

That the said Justice, having heard the complaint upon said, charge had exclusive jurisidiction of the trial of said charge, rules the complaintants should be found guilty and it also be found that the offense would not be sufficently by a fine not exceeding $100.00; and that all the proceeding, upon said commitment and the said commitment are illegal and void.
Therefore said Gowen and Webster pray to be discharged from custody.
div1.ab: Dated Feb 26th 1883 Hall + Wood for Applicants
No 3181 Habeas Corpus In Re Gowen and Webster Demmener to Return Filed Feburary 27th 1883 James Seavey, Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
